metadata.title: bioinformatics-policlinicogemelli/Varan: Varan 2.1.2
metadata.description:
Welcome to the new Varan release! 🦎

Enhancements

  • Docker version now available
  • Varan is now compatible with vcf 4.1 and 4.2
  • An accurate and detailed report is now automatically created inside each new study
  • The offline cBioPortal validator is now embedded in our code
  • New filters are now available!

Changelog

https://github.com/bioinformatics-policlinicogemelli/Varan/commits/v2.1.2

metadata.title: NMR for structural biology: from principles to Protein-ligand complexes
metadata.description:
The ML4NGP Training School on NMR for Intrinsically Disordered Proteins took place in Brno, Czech Republic, from February 3-7, 2025.

This event introduced bioinformatics and life sciences researchers to the fundamentals of NMR data analysis and interpretation, focusing on potential biases and limitations in studying intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs). Through a mix of theoretical sessions, interactive discussions, and hands-on training, participants gained practical insights into how NMR data reflects IDP behavior in near-native states, enhancing their understanding of non-globular proteins.

This lecture explores the principles of NMR and its applications for structural biology, including characterization of protein-ligand complexes.

metadata.title: Cross Correlation Relaxation and Residual Dipolar Couplings
metadata.description:
The ML4NGP Training School on NMR for Intrinsically Disordered Proteins took place in Brno, Czech Republic, from February 3-7, 2025.

This event introduced bioinformatics and life sciences researchers to the fundamentals of NMR data analysis and interpretation, focusing on potential biases and limitations in studying intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs). Through a mix of theoretical sessions, interactive discussions, and hands-on training, participants gained practical insights into how NMR data reflects IDP behavior in near-native states, enhancing their understanding of non-globular proteins.

This lecture covered Cross Correlation Relaxation (CCR), including its impact on 2D NMR spectra, the TROSY effect, key properties, and applications in globular and intrinsically disordered proteins, as well as Residual Dipolar Couplings (RDCs), focusing on dipole-dipole interactions, alignment requirements, measurement techniques, and their use in studying IDPs.

metadata.title: The canine vaginal microbiome in heat does not influence fertility in healthy breeding bitches
metadata.description: A healthy and balanced vaginal microbiome is often thought to be an important prerequisite for successful breeding and healthy litters. Previous studies investigating the influence of canine vaginal bacteria on fertility mostly relied on aerobic culturing. In recent years, culture-independent methods, such as next-generation sequencing (NGS), have become popular. With the ability to analyze the microbiome as a whole, research in this field has made notable advances. This is the first study to correlate NGS data of the canine vaginal microbiome in heat with fertility data. Healthy breeding bitches (n=80) presented for routine pre-breeding examination were sampled during early heat and mated after ovulation. A vaginal sample was taken for NGS analysis and microbiological culture. Additionally, a blood sample was collected. Fertility data (mating, pregnancy, delivery, litter size) were assessed. NGS revealed a diverse microbiome in all the samples. Bioinformatics and statistical analysis did not provide evidence of larger differences in the microbiome of those bitches that became pregnant and those that did not.

data.title: The canine vaginal microbiome in heat does not influence fertility in healthy breeding bitches
